description: A Venus flytrap engages its prey, a fly, in dialogue before consumption, introducing an element of absurdism through its anthropomorphic ability to speak. The plant makes a request for the fly's stereo, demonstrating dark humor and irony as it prioritizes material possessions over the fly's impending fate. This interaction creates a surreal scenario where predator-prey dynamics are overlaid with mundane, social interactions.
caption: "I don't mean to be callous, Earl, but can I have your stereo?"
